summary.p: [1] Yesterday, Blarer entrusted a letter [No. 2935] to the young Maximilian Seemann. If Bullinger has not yet received it, it will certainly happen in the next few days.
[2] There is nothing new in Konstanz, only what the wedding party, which is coming to Zürich, will tell.
[3] Bullinger should convey detailed information about the Baden Diet through the bearer [...].
[4] Enclosed is a letter and ten guilders for Hans Schöner.
[5] Request for prayer. Blessing wish and greeting.

div.p: Greetings. I wrote to you yesterday through the young Maximilian Seemann. If you have not yet received that letter, you will certainly receive it either tomorrow or the day after.
There is nothing new here with us that I can tell you, except for what our people, who are flying over there for the wedding, will be able to tell you.
Through this bearer, please inform me diligently about the Baden Diet.
I am sending a letter here with 10 gold coins to our Schöner, and I earnestly beg you to ensure they are delivered to him.
Pray diligently for us. May your household be well along with all who love us. Our people send their greetings to you. July 2, 1547. Yours, Ambrosius Blarer.
